span.p: The VMAX 40K Engine is the key system bay component that provides physical memory, CPU processing power , front-end host, SRDF and external array connectivity, back-end connectivity to Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs), and connectivity to other engines in the array. Each engine includes:

ul.li: Two directors that support front-end, back-end, external array and SRDF connections
Four System Interface boards (SIB) (two per director) that connect the director and the Matrix Interface Board Enclosures (MIBEs)
Four Back End I/O Modules (two per director, available with or without encryption
Four Front End I/O Modules (two per director) that provide the following connections( per module)
2 Fibre Channel over Ethernet ( FCoE) ports (10 Gb/s)
2 Management Modules that provide environmental monitoring
